page.title: 15The Fire Station.
page.content: Craven Arms fire station is a small local fire station on the A49. It has a part time staff of 10 people including an officer in charge Mr. Mills. The chief officer is based in the main station for South Shropshire which is situated in Ludlow. The station has just one fire tender which is a Ford.It is equipped with all the necessary equipment such as hoses,ladders,breathing apparatus, cutting equipment and first aid. When needed to attend a fire the firemen are signalled by a bleeper which they carry with them at all times.The bleepers are set off when the alarm is given at the main station in Ludlow. The uniform is the standard yellow fibreglass helmet,black tunic,yellow overtrousers and black rubber boots.
